intro: Boehmeria diffusa var. canescens, commonly known as cottonleaf or Chinese cotton, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the nettle family (Urticaceae) and is characterized by its soft, fluffy, silver-white leaves that resemble cotton. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It produces small greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
